fields.hint: Name of the Integration Service that runs the workflow.
fields.label: IS servicename
fields.name: servicename

fields.hint: Name of the folder containing the workflow
fields.label: foldername
fields.name: foldername

fields.hint: Name of the workflow to run
fields.label: workflowname
fields.name: workflowname

fields.hint: Indicates the recovery strategy for the session task: - NORMAL. Restarts a session without recovery. - RECOVERY. Recovers a session.
fields.label: requestmode
fields.name: requestmode

fields.hint: log level: DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL
fields.label: loglevel
fields.name: loglevel

name: ut-informatica-powercenter
scriptUnix:
#!/opt/universal/python3.6/bin/python3
#
#  Name:               UT_Informatica_RunWorkflow
#  Purpose:            Universal Task Script to Run an Informatica Workflow
#                      1- Get Session ID (logon_token)
#                      2- Start Workflow
#                      3- Monitor Workflow Completion
#                      4- Get Session Log
#                      5- Close Session
#  Disclaimer
#  No support and no warranty are provided for this Universal Task.
#  The use of this document and the related Universal Task is on your own risk.
#  Before using this task in a production system, please perform extensive
#  testing.
#
#  Version History:
#     0.1  NBU     2017-03-17     initial Version using a shell script and curl
#     1.0  CCO     2017-10-02     Conversion from Shell Script Version to python
#     1.1  NBU     2017-12-20     Using getWorkflowLog instead of getSessionLog
#     2.0  NBU     2018-01-09     Added Logon Token support, Logging, doc
#                                 strings and intensive error handling
#     2.1  NBU     2018-01-11     Added support for Https connections
#     2.2  NBU     2018-07-08     changed envelope header
#     2.3  NBU     2021-02-05     diagnose print functions added
#     2.4  NBU     2021-02-05     cleanup
#     2.5  NBU     2021-02-05     GetSessionLog added
#     2.6  NBU     2021-02-05     GetSessionLog print the correct taskname
#                                 two new choice fields
#     2.7  NBU     2021-02-05     cleanup
#     2.8  NBU     2021-02-05     choice for session or wf log added
#     2.9  NBU     2021-02-05     choice for session or wf log added
#     3.0  NBU     2021-02-08     Funcation start task and start from task added
#     3.1  NBU     2021-02-08     Funcation start task and start from task added
#     3.2  NBU     2021-02-09     ops_var_taskinstancepath changed to ops_var_taskinstance_path
#
# --

# -- Import required python modules
import argparse
import logging
import site
import sys
from xml.dom.minidom import parseString

import requests

gl_version = "3.2"
gl_variable_prefix = "var"
gl_get_session_log = "${ops_var_getsessionlog}"
gl_error_messages = ""
gl_action = "${ops_var_action}"
gl_task_instance_path = "${ops_var_task_instance_path}"
gl_get_session_log_for_task = "${ops_var_get_session_log_for_task}"
# -- logging settings DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL
logging.basicConfig(level="${ops_var_loglevel}",
                    format=' %(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')


# -- Main Logic Function
def main():
    """calls the required functions to run the informatica workflow"""
    global gl_get_session_log
    print_variables()
    set_variables()  # - Set Variables from UTask Form or Command Line Input
    get_session_id()  # - Create SessionID Request SOAP Env and Req Sess. ID
    if gl_error_messages:
        logging.error(f"There were errors in the logs:\n {gl_error_messages}")
        exit(1)
    if gl_action == "startWorkflow":
        start_workflow()  # - Start Informatica Workflow
        monitor_workflow()  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_workflow_log_xml()  # - Return the workflow log
        pass
    elif gl_action == "startTask":
        start_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # 'SOAPAction': 'startTask'
        monitor_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_session_log(gl_task_instance_path)
        gl_get_session_log = "false"
        pass
    elif gl_action == "startWorkflowFromTask":
        start_workflow_from_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # - Start Informatica Workflow
        monitor_workflow()  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_workflow_log_xml()  # - Return the workflow log
        pass
    if gl_get_session_log == "true":
        get_session_log(gl_get_session_log_for_task)  # - Returns the session log of the provided task
    close_session()  # - Logout from Session


def print_variables():
    """logging.infos out the python and script version
    and all universal template variables
    """
    logging.info("Python version <<< " + sys.version + " >>>")
    logging.info("Python sites <<< " + str(site.getsitepackages()) + " >>>")
    logging.info("Executing task version " + gl_version + " with the following "
                                                          "parameters")
    print_defined_variables(gl_variable_prefix)


def print_defined_variables(variable_prefix):
    """logging.info's out universal template variables"""
    all_variables = r"${_scope}"
    separate_variables = [variable for variable in all_variables.split(', ') if
                          "ops_" + variable_prefix in variable]
    logging.info(str(separate_variables).replace(", ", ",\n"))


# -- Set Variables from Universal Task Form or Command Line Input
def set_variables():
    """Set Variables from Universal Task Form or Command Line Input"""
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description='Purpose : Run Informatica Workflow')
    parser.add_argument("--port", default="${ops_var_info_port}")
    parser.add_argument("--host", default="${ops_var_info_host}")
    parser.add_argument("--domain", default="${ops_var_domainname}")
    parser.add_argument("--repository", default="${ops_var_repositoryname}")
    parser.add_argument("--username",
                        default="${_credentialUser('${ops_var_infocred}')}")
    parser.add_argument("--password",
                        default="${_credentialPwd('${ops_var_infocred}')}")
    parser.add_argument("--namespace", default="${ops_var_usernamespace}")
    parser.add_argument("--service", default="${ops_var_servicename}")
    parser.add_argument("--folder", default="${ops_var_foldername}")
    parser.add_argument("--workflow", default="${ops_var_workflowname}")
    parser.add_argument("--requestmode", default="${ops_var_requestmode}")
    parser.add_argument("--timeout", default="${ops_var_timeout}")
    parser.add_argument("--path", default="${ops_var_taskinstance_path}")
    parser.add_argument("--loglevel", default="${ops_var_loglevel}")
    parser.add_argument("--ssl", default="${ops_var_ssl}")
    global args
    global logon_token
    args = parser.parse_args()
    # logging.info(" -- Executing version " + version
    # + " with the following paramaters")
    logging.info(args)
    logging.info(" -- Informatica Workflow to run: " + args.workflow)


def check_response(log_type, response_text):
    global gl_error_messages
    error_messages = ""
    for response_line in response_text.split("\n"):
        logging.debug(response_line)
        if "ERROR : " in response_line:
            error_messages += response_line + "\n"
    if error_messages:
        gl_error_messages += f"ERROR(s) found in {log_type}:\n{error_messages}"
    pass


# -- Create SessionID Request SOAP Envelope and Request Session ID
def get_session_id():
    """Create SessionID Request SOAP Envelope and Request Session ID"""
    logging.info("get_session_id")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header/>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:Login xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <RepositoryDomainName>{domain}</RepositoryDomainName>
                <RepositoryName>{repository}</RepositoryName>
                <UserName>{username}</UserName>
                <Password>{password}</Password>
                <UserNameSpace>{namespace}</UserNameSpace>
            </ns0:Login>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(domain=args.domain, repository=args.repository,
               username=args.username, password=args.password,
               namespace=args.namespace)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/Metadata"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'login'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Requesting Session ID (SOAP Request)")
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML" + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info("#UT_INFO# Request SessionId Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        dom = parseString(response.content)
        for node in dom.getElementsByTagName('SessionId'):  # visit every node
            global logon_token
            logon_token = str(node.childNodes[0].data)


# -- Start Informatica Workflow
def start_workflow():
    """Start Informatica Workflow using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startWorkflow'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting Workflow (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Workflow Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Start Informatica Task
def start_task(task_instance_path):
    """Start Informatica Task using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startTask'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting Task (SOAP Request)  " + task_instance_path + ", in WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, Taskname: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, task_instance_path, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Task Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


def monitor_task(task_instance_path):
    """Monitor Informatica Task"""
    logging.info("monitor_task")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
            <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:WaitTillTaskComplete xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </ns0:WaitTillTaskComplete>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'WaitTillTaskComplete'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Monitoring Task (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Start Informatica Workflow from a specific task
def start_workflow_from_task(task_instance_path):
    """Start Informatica Workflow from a specific task using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startWorkflowFromTask'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting WF from Task (SOAP Request)  " + task_instance_path + ", in WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, Taskname: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, task_instance_path, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Task Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Monitor Informatica Workflow
def monitor_workflow():
    """Monitor Informatica Workflow"""
    logging.info("monitor_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
            <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:WaitTillWorkflowComplete xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
            </ns0:WaitTillWorkflowComplete>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'WaitTillWorkflowComplete'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Monitoring Workflow (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Return the session log
def get_workflow_log_xml():
    """Return the session log from the Informatica Workflow"""
    logging.info("get_workflow_log")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
     <soap:Header>
      <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
         <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
      </ns0:Context>
     </soap:Header>
     <soap:Body xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
      <ns0:GetWorkflowLog>
         <DIServiceInfo>
            <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
            <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
         </DIServiceInfo>
         <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
         <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
         <Timeout>{timeout}</Timeout>
      </ns0:GetWorkflowLog>
     </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               timeout=args.timeout)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'getWorkflowLog'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Workflow Log: " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        check_response("WorkflowLog", response.text)


def get_session_log(task_instance_path):
    """Return the session log from the Informatica"""
    logging.info("get_session_log")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
     <soap:Header>
      <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
         <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
      </ns0:Context>
     </soap:Header>
     <soap:Body xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
      <ns0:GetSessionLog>
         <DIServiceInfo>
            <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
            <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
         </DIServiceInfo>
         <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
         <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
         <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
         <Timeout>{timeout}</Timeout>
      </ns0:GetSessionLog>
     </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path, timeout=args.timeout)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'getSessionLog'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Session Log: " + task_instance_path)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        check_response("SessionLog", response.text)


# -- Logout from Session
def close_session():
    """Logout from Session"""
    logging.info("close_session")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
           <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
              <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
           </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
           <ns0:Logout xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh"/>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/Metadata"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'Logout'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Closing Session (SOAP Request)")
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
scriptWindows:
#!/opt/universal/python3.6/bin/python3
#
#  Name:               UT_Informatica_RunWorkflow
#  Purpose:            Universal Task Script to Run an Informatica Workflow
#                      1- Get Session ID (logon_token)
#                      2- Start Workflow
#                      3- Monitor Workflow Completion
#                      4- Get Session Log
#                      5- Close Session
#  Disclaimer
#  No support and no warranty are provided for this Universal Task.
#  The use of this document and the related Universal Task is on your own risk.
#  Before using this task in a production system, please perform extensive
#  testing.
#
#  Version History:
#     0.1  NBU     2017-03-17     initial Version using a shell script and curl
#     1.0  CCO     2017-10-02     Conversion from Shell Script Version to python
#     1.1  NBU     2017-12-20     Using getWorkflowLog instead of getSessionLog
#     2.0  NBU     2018-01-09     Added Logon Token support, Logging, doc
#                                 strings and intensive error handling
#     2.1  NBU     2018-01-11     Added support for Https connections
#     2.2  NBU     2018-07-08     changed envelope header
#     2.3  NBU     2021-02-05     diagnose print functions added
#     2.4  NBU     2021-02-05     cleanup
#     2.5  NBU     2021-02-05     GetSessionLog added
#     2.6  NBU     2021-02-05     GetSessionLog print the correct taskname
#                                 two new choice fields
#     2.7  NBU     2021-02-05     cleanup
#     2.8  NBU     2021-02-05     choice for session or wf log added
#     2.9  NBU     2021-02-05     choice for session or wf log added
#     3.0  NBU     2021-02-08     Funcation start task and start from task added
#     3.1  NBU     2021-02-08     Funcation start task and start from task added
#     3.2  NBU     2021-02-09     ops_var_taskinstancepath changed to ops_var_taskinstance_path
#
# --

# -- Import required python modules
import argparse
import logging
import site
import sys
from xml.dom.minidom import parseString

import requests

gl_version = "3.2"
gl_variable_prefix = "var"
gl_get_session_log = "${ops_var_getsessionlog}"
gl_error_messages = ""
gl_action = "${ops_var_action}"
gl_task_instance_path = "${ops_var_task_instance_path}"
gl_get_session_log_for_task = "${ops_var_get_session_log_for_task}"
# -- logging settings DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL
logging.basicConfig(level="${ops_var_loglevel}",
                    format=' %(asctime)s - %(levelname)s - %(message)s')


# -- Main Logic Function
def main():
    """calls the required functions to run the informatica workflow"""
    global gl_get_session_log
    print_variables()
    set_variables()  # - Set Variables from UTask Form or Command Line Input
    get_session_id()  # - Create SessionID Request SOAP Env and Req Sess. ID
    if gl_error_messages:
        logging.error(f"There were errors in the logs:\n {gl_error_messages}")
        exit(1)
    if gl_action == "startWorkflow":
        start_workflow()  # - Start Informatica Workflow
        monitor_workflow()  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_workflow_log_xml()  # - Return the workflow log
        pass
    elif gl_action == "startTask":
        start_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # 'SOAPAction': 'startTask'
        monitor_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_session_log(gl_task_instance_path)
        gl_get_session_log = "false"
        pass
    elif gl_action == "startWorkflowFromTask":
        start_workflow_from_task(gl_task_instance_path)  # - Start Informatica Workflow
        monitor_workflow()  # - Monitor Informatica Workflow
        get_workflow_log_xml()  # - Return the workflow log
        pass
    if gl_get_session_log == "true":
        get_session_log(gl_get_session_log_for_task)  # - Returns the session log of the provided task
    close_session()  # - Logout from Session


def print_variables():
    """logging.infos out the python and script version
    and all universal template variables
    """
    logging.info("Python version <<< " + sys.version + " >>>")
    logging.info("Python sites <<< " + str(site.getsitepackages()) + " >>>")
    logging.info("Executing task version " + gl_version + " with the following "
                                                          "parameters")
    print_defined_variables(gl_variable_prefix)


def print_defined_variables(variable_prefix):
    """logging.info's out universal template variables"""
    all_variables = r"${_scope}"
    separate_variables = [variable for variable in all_variables.split(', ') if
                          "ops_" + variable_prefix in variable]
    logging.info(str(separate_variables).replace(", ", ",\n"))


# -- Set Variables from Universal Task Form or Command Line Input
def set_variables():
    """Set Variables from Universal Task Form or Command Line Input"""
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description='Purpose : Run Informatica Workflow')
    parser.add_argument("--port", default="${ops_var_info_port}")
    parser.add_argument("--host", default="${ops_var_info_host}")
    parser.add_argument("--domain", default="${ops_var_domainname}")
    parser.add_argument("--repository", default="${ops_var_repositoryname}")
    parser.add_argument("--username",
                        default="${_credentialUser('${ops_var_infocred}')}")
    parser.add_argument("--password",
                        default="${_credentialPwd('${ops_var_infocred}')}")
    parser.add_argument("--namespace", default="${ops_var_usernamespace}")
    parser.add_argument("--service", default="${ops_var_servicename}")
    parser.add_argument("--folder", default="${ops_var_foldername}")
    parser.add_argument("--workflow", default="${ops_var_workflowname}")
    parser.add_argument("--requestmode", default="${ops_var_requestmode}")
    parser.add_argument("--timeout", default="${ops_var_timeout}")
    parser.add_argument("--path", default="${ops_var_taskinstance_path}")
    parser.add_argument("--loglevel", default="${ops_var_loglevel}")
    parser.add_argument("--ssl", default="${ops_var_ssl}")
    global args
    global logon_token
    args = parser.parse_args()
    # logging.info(" -- Executing version " + version
    # + " with the following paramaters")
    logging.info(args)
    logging.info(" -- Informatica Workflow to run: " + args.workflow)


def check_response(log_type, response_text):
    global gl_error_messages
    error_messages = ""
    for response_line in response_text.split("\n"):
        logging.debug(response_line)
        if "ERROR : " in response_line:
            error_messages += response_line + "\n"
    if error_messages:
        gl_error_messages += f"ERROR(s) found in {log_type}:\n{error_messages}"
    pass


# -- Create SessionID Request SOAP Envelope and Request Session ID
def get_session_id():
    """Create SessionID Request SOAP Envelope and Request Session ID"""
    logging.info("get_session_id")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header/>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:Login xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <RepositoryDomainName>{domain}</RepositoryDomainName>
                <RepositoryName>{repository}</RepositoryName>
                <UserName>{username}</UserName>
                <Password>{password}</Password>
                <UserNameSpace>{namespace}</UserNameSpace>
            </ns0:Login>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(domain=args.domain, repository=args.repository,
               username=args.username, password=args.password,
               namespace=args.namespace)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/Metadata"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'login'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Requesting Session ID (SOAP Request)")
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML" + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info("#UT_INFO# Request SessionId Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        dom = parseString(response.content)
        for node in dom.getElementsByTagName('SessionId'):  # visit every node
            global logon_token
            logon_token = str(node.childNodes[0].data)


# -- Start Informatica Workflow
def start_workflow():
    """Start Informatica Workflow using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startWorkflow'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting Workflow (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Workflow Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Start Informatica Task
def start_task(task_instance_path):
    """Start Informatica Task using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startTask'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting Task (SOAP Request)  " + task_instance_path + ", in WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, Taskname: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, task_instance_path, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Task Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


def monitor_task(task_instance_path):
    """Monitor Informatica Task"""
    logging.info("monitor_task")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
            <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:WaitTillTaskComplete xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </ns0:WaitTillTaskComplete>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'WaitTillTaskComplete'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Monitoring Task (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Start Informatica Workflow from a specific task
def start_workflow_from_task(task_instance_path):
    """Start Informatica Workflow from a specific task using the requested Session ID"""
    logging.info("start_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:wsh=\"http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
        <soapenv:Header>
            <wsh:Context>
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </wsh:Context>
        </soapenv:Header>
        <soapenv:Body>
            <wsh:StartWorkflow>
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
                <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
            </wsh:StartWorkflow>
        </soapenv:Body>
    </soapenv:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'startWorkflowFromTask'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Starting WF from Task (SOAP Request)  " + task_instance_path + ", in WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        logging.error(
            ' Check that the Workflow: %s, Taskname: %s, foldername: %s and is_servicename: %s are correct.' % (
                args.workflow, task_instance_path, args.folder, args.service))
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" Starting Task Succeeded with code : " + str(
            response.status_code))
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Monitor Informatica Workflow
def monitor_workflow():
    """Monitor Informatica Workflow"""
    logging.info("monitor_workflow")
    # -- Create SOAP XML
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
            <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
            </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
            <ns0:WaitTillWorkflowComplete xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
                <DIServiceInfo>
                    <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
                    <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
                </DIServiceInfo>
                <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
                <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
                <RequestMode>{requestmode}</RequestMode>
            </ns0:WaitTillWorkflowComplete>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               requestmode=args.requestmode)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'WaitTillWorkflowComplete'
    }
    logging.info(
        " -- Monitoring Workflow (SOAP Request) WORKFLOW = " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


# -- Return the session log
def get_workflow_log_xml():
    """Return the session log from the Informatica Workflow"""
    logging.info("get_workflow_log")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
     <soap:Header>
      <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
         <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
      </ns0:Context>
     </soap:Header>
     <soap:Body xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
      <ns0:GetWorkflowLog>
         <DIServiceInfo>
            <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
            <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
         </DIServiceInfo>
         <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
         <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
         <Timeout>{timeout}</Timeout>
      </ns0:GetWorkflowLog>
     </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               timeout=args.timeout)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'getWorkflowLog'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Workflow Log: " + args.workflow)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        check_response("WorkflowLog", response.text)


def get_session_log(task_instance_path):
    """Return the session log from the Informatica"""
    logging.info("get_session_log")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
     <soap:Header>
      <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
         <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
      </ns0:Context>
     </soap:Header>
     <soap:Body xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
      <ns0:GetSessionLog>
         <DIServiceInfo>
            <DomainName>{domain}</DomainName>
            <ServiceName>{service}</ServiceName>
         </DIServiceInfo>
         <FolderName>{folder}</FolderName>
         <WorkflowName>{workflow}</WorkflowName>
         <TaskInstancePath>{task_instance_path}</TaskInstancePath>
         <Timeout>{timeout}</Timeout>
      </ns0:GetSessionLog>
     </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token, domain=args.domain,
               service=args.service, folder=args.folder, workflow=args.workflow,
               task_instance_path=task_instance_path, timeout=args.timeout)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/DataIntegration?WSDL"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'getSessionLog'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Session Log: " + task_instance_path)
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.info(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)
        check_response("SessionLog", response.text)


# -- Logout from Session
def close_session():
    """Logout from Session"""
    logging.info("close_session")
    soap_xml = """
    <soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
        <soap:Header>
           <ns0:Context xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh">
              <SessionId>{logon_token}</SessionId>
           </ns0:Context>
        </soap:Header>
        <soap:Body>
           <ns0:Logout xmlns:ns0="http://www.informatica.com/wsh"/>
        </soap:Body>
    </soap:Envelope>
    """.format(logon_token=logon_token)
    # -- Set SoapCall() Parameters and Make SOAP Request
    soap_data = soap_xml.encode('utf-8')
    soap_url = args.ssl + args.host + ":" + args.port + "/wsh/services/BatchServices/Metadata"
    soap_headers = {
        'content-type': 'text/soap+xml',
        'charset': 'UTF-8',
        'SOAPAction': 'Logout'
    }
    logging.info(" -- Closing Session (SOAP Request)")
    logging.debug(" -- Request XML: " + soap_xml)
    try:
        response = requests.post(soap_url, data=soap_data, headers=soap_headers,
                                 verify=False)
        response.raise_for_status()
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        logging.error(' Failure : %s' % e)
        exit(1)
    else:
        logging.debug(" -- Response XML: " + response.text)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
